snippet: President Xi Jinping’s traditional leanings, along with Communist Party decrees that have declared open season on dissenters, have emboldened Maoist ideologues.
abstract: China's long-marginalized Maoist ideologues are experiencing a resurgence under traditionalism of Pres Xi Jinping and Communist Party that has declared open season on dissent; ideological vigilantes have played pivotal role in the downfall of professors, journalists, artists and politicians amid crackdown on political opposition and Western-oriented thinkers.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and ANDREW JACOBS
byline.contributor: Chris Buckley reported from Hong Kong, and Andrew Jacobs from Beijing. Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting from Beijing, and Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: President Xi Jinping’s traditional leanings, along with Communist Party decrees that have declared open season on dissenters, have emboldened Maoist ideologues.

headline.main: Maoists in China, Given New Life, Attack Dissent
headline.print_headline: Maoists in China, Given New Life, Attack Dissent
